scavengeo

a bright new zealand

I find myself looking at New Zealand as of late with my sister abroad in Wellington. It’s a good excuse to make some new maps, so naturally, I chose to get the OSM Bright sample up and running again.

OSM Bright

For those of you who don’t know about OSM Bright, it’s a full-featured bootstrapped TileMill project for styling OSM data. There are some tricks to getting started but following the OSM Bright Quickstart step by step will get you where you need to go. Working with the sample can be a large undertaking but I’m just starting small with a focus on text and playing around with simple styles. I also grabbed a hillshade from NASA and georeferenced it to give it some depth but it’s a bit too coarse to display well.

It’s a good start and fun data to play around with. Hopefully, I can get over to Wellington and do some on-the-ground-mapping.

- rafa
